question: If a bedroom wall and perhaps the carpet has some semen stains on it which are difficult to remove, is it fine to pray in such a room? What if you've already prayed in this room? The actual place where you put the prayer mat is clean.
answer:
QUESTION

 

If a bedroom wall and perhaps the carpet has some semen stains on it which are difficult to remove, is it fine to pray in such a room? What if you've already prayed in this room? The actual place where you put the prayer mat is clean. Jazakallah Khair.

ANSWER


Share:

 

In the name of Allāh, Most Gracious, Most Merciful


Assalāmu ῾alaykum wa Rahmatullāhi Wabarakātuh

 

In principle, the salah will be valid if it is offered on a clean (pure) area. Therefore, your salah was valid. In future offer your salah on the clean praying mat. However, it is advisable to clean those areas that has najasah on it.

And Allāh Ta῾āla Knows Best
Wassalāmu ῾alaykum




Ml. Abdur Rahman Shareef,
Student Dārul Iftā
